meanings.definition: The act of transmitting radio or television programs to a wide audience.
meanings.sent1: Broadcasting allows many people to listen to the same radio show.
meanings.sent2: The broadcasting of news reaches viewers all over the country.
meanings.sent3: The broadcasting of the weather forecast helps everyone plan their day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a form of broadcasting joy.
meanings.sent5: The broadcasting of emergency alerts ensures everyone stays informed during crises.

meanings.definition: The distribution of information to a wide audience.
meanings.sent1: Through broadcasting, important messages can reach a large number of people.
meanings.sent2: The broadcasting of educational programs benefits students of all ages.
meanings.sent3: The broadcasting of rumors can sometimes cause unnecessary panic.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a form of broadcasting happiness to everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The broadcasting of safety instructions is crucial in emergency situations.

meanings.definition: To transmit a message or program over radio or television.
meanings.sent1: They are broadcasting the live concert on television tonight.
meanings.sent2: The radio station will be broadcasting the game for all the fans.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would be broadcasting her cooking skills on TV.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to be broadcasting a message of gratitude to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The speaker's voice was broadcasting confidence to the audience.
